trans-unit.source: Provides helper logging methods used by tasks.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper"></xref> class and associates it with the specified task instance.
The task containing an instance of this task.
Public constructor which can be used by task factories to assist them in logging messages.
The build engine.
The task name.
Gets the build engine that is associated with the task.
An <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine"></xref> that represents the instance of the build engine that is associated with the task.
Extracts the message code prefix from the given full message string.
Message code prefixes must match the following .NET regular expressions in order to be recognized: `^\s*[A-Za-z]+\d+:\s*`.
The full message to parse that includes code prefix.
The message with the code prefix removed.
The message code prefix that is extracted from the full message string, or `null` if there is no message code.
message is `null`.
Loads the specified resource string and optionally formats it using the given arguments.
The culture of the current thread is used for formatting.

This method requires the owner task to have registered its resources with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.TaskResources%2A> property.
The name of the string resource to load.
Optional arguments for formatting the loaded string.
The formatted string.
The string resource indicated by resourceName does not exist.
The <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.TaskResources"></xref> property of the owner task is not set.
resourceName is `null`.
Formats the given string using the given arguments.
The culture of the current thread is used for formatting.
The string to format.
Arguments for formatting.
The formatted string.
unformatted is `null`.
Gets the message from resource in task library.
The resource name.
Returns the message from resource in task library.
Gets a value that indicates whether the task has logged any errors through this logging helper object.
`true` if the task has logged any errors through this logging helper object; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the prefix used to compose Help keywords from resource names.
If a task does not have Help keywords associated with its messages, it can ignore this property or set it to `null`.
If this property is set to an empty <xref:System.String>, resource names will be used verbatim as Help keywords.
The prefix used to compose Help keywords from resource names.
InitializeLifetimeService is called when the remote object is activated.
This method will determine how long the lifetime for the object will be.
Thread safe.
However, InitializeLifetimeService and MarkAsInactive should only be called in that order, together or not at all, and no more than once.
The lease object to control this object's lifetime.
Logs the command line for an underlying tool, executable file, or shell command of a task.
This method is not thread-safe.
The command line string.
Logs the command line for an underlying tool, executable file, or shell command of a task using the specified importance level.
This method is not thread-safe.
One of the values of <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.MessageImportance"></xref> that indicates the importance level of the command line.
The command line string.
Logs a critical message using the specified string and other message details.
Thread safe.
Description of the warning type (can be null).
Message code (can be null).
The help keyword for the host IDE (can be null).
The path to the file causing the message (can be null).
The line in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The column in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The last line of a range of lines in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The last column of a range of columns in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The message string.
Optional arguments for formatting the message string.
Thrown when message is null.
Logs an error with the specified message.
This method is not thread-safe.
The message.
Optional arguments for formatting the message string.
message is `null`.
Logs an error using the specified message and other error details.
The parameters `subCategory`, `errorCode`, `helpKeyword`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.
The description of the error type.
The error code.
The Help keyword to associate with the error.
The path to the file containing the error.
The line in the file where the error occurs.
The column in the file where the error occurs.
The end line in the file where the error occurs.
The end column in the file where the error occurs.
The message.
Optional arguments for formatting the message string.
message is `null`.
Logs an error using the message from the given exception.
No call stack will be shown.
The exception to log.
e is `null`.
Logs an error using the message, and optionally the stack trace, from the given exception.
This method is not thread-safe.
The exception to log
`true` to include the stack trace in the log; otherwise, `false`.
e is `null`.
Logs an error using the message, and optionally the stack-trace from the given exception and any inner exceptions.
The exception to log.
`true` to include the stack trace in the log; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to log exception types and any inner exceptions; otherwise, `false`.
The name of the file related to the exception, or `null` if the project file should be logged.
e is `null`.
Logs an error using the specified resource string.
This method is not thread-safe.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
messageResourceName is `null`.
Logs an error using the specified resource string and other error details.
The parameters `subCategoryResourceName`, `errorCode`, `helpKeyword`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.
The name of the string resource that describes the error type.
The error code.
The Help keyword to associate with the error.
The path to the file containing the error.
The line in the file where the error occurs.
The column in the file where the error occurs.
The end line in the file where the error occurs.
The end column in the file where the error occurs.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
messageResourceName is `null`.
Logs an error using the specified resource string and other error details.
If the message begins with an error code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message.
The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix.
A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.
The parameters `subCategoryResourceName`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.
The name of the string resource that describes the error type.
The path to the file containing the error.
The line in the file where the error occurs.
The column in the file where the error occurs.
The end line in the file where the error occurs.
The end column in the file where the error occurs.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
messageResourceName is `null`.
Logs an error with an error code using the specified resource string.
If the message begins with an error code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message.
The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix.
A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
messageResourceName is `null`.
Helps log the custom <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.ExternalProjectFinishedEventArgs"></xref> build event.
The text message.
The help keyword.
The name of the project.
`true` to indicate that project was built successfully; otherwise, `false`.
Helps log the custom <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.ExternalProjectStartedEventArgs"></xref> build event.
The text message.
The help keyword.
The name of the project.
The targets to build.
An empty string indicates default targets.
Logs a message with the specified string.
The <xref:Microsoft.Build.Framework.MessageImportance> value of a message is `Normal` by default.
The message.
The arguments for formatting the message.
message is `null`.
Logs a message with the specified string and importance.
Take care to order the parameters correctly or the other overload will be called inadvertently.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the importance of the message.
The message.
The arguments for formatting the message.
message is `null`.
Logs a message using the specified string and other message details.
Thread safe.
Description of the warning type (can be null).
Message code (can be null)
The help keyword for the host IDE (can be null).
The path to the file causing the message (can be null).
The line in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The column in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The last line of a range of lines in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The last column of a range of columns in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
Importance of the message.
The message string.
Optional arguments for formatting the message string.
Thrown when message is null.
Logs a message with the specified resource string.
The <xref:Microsoft.Build.Framework.MessageImportance> value of a message is `Normal` by default.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
messageResourceName is `null`.
Logs a message with the specified resource string and importance.
Take care to order the parameters correctly or the other overload will be called inadvertently.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the importance of the message.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
message is `null`.
Logs an error message or warning from the given line of text.
Errors messages and warnings are only logged for lines that fit the canonical format.
All other lines are treated as messages.
The line of text to log from.
One of the values of <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.MessageImportance"></xref> that indicates the importance level of the command line.
`true` if an error was logged; otherwise, `false`.
lineOfText is `null`.
Logs errors, warnings, and messages for each line of text in the given file.
Also logs the importance of messages.
Errors and warnings are logged for lines that fit a particular canonical format.
All other lines are logged as messages.
The name of the file to log messages from.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the importance of logged messages.
`true` to indicate at least one error was logged; otherwise, `false`.
Thrown when filename is null.
Logs errors, warnings, and messages for each line of text in the given file.
Errors and warnings are logged for lines that fit a particular canonical format.
All other lines are logged as messages.
The name of the file to log messages from.
`true` to indicate at least one error was logged; otherwise, `false`.
message is `null`.
Logs an error message or warning from the given stream.
This method is not thread-safe.
A <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> that reads the stream to log from.
One of the values of <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.MessageImportance"></xref> that indicates the importance level of the command line.
`true` if an error was logged; otherwise, `false`.
stream is `null`.
Logs a warning with the specified message.
This method is not thread-safe.
The message.
Optional arguments for formatting the message string.
message is `null`.
Logs a warning using the specified message and other warning details.
The parameters `subCategory`, `warningCode`, `helpKeyword`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.
The description of the warning type.
The warning code.
The Help keyword to associate with the warning.
The path to the file containing the warning.
The line in the file where the warning occurs.
The column in the file where the warning occurs.
The end line in the file where the warning occurs.
The end column in the file where the warning occurs.
The message.
Optional arguments for formatting the message string.
message is `null`.
Logs a warning using the message from the specified exception.
This method is not thread-safe.
The exception to log.
e is `null`.
Logs a warning using the message, and optionally the stack trace, from the given exception.
This method is not thread-safe.
The exception to log
`true` to include the stack trace in the log; otherwise, `false`.
e is `null`.
Logs a warning using the specified resource string.
This method is not thread-safe.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
messageResourceName is `null`.
Logs a warning using the specified resource string and other warning details.
The parameters `subCategoryResourceName`, `warningCode`, `helpKeyword`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.
The name of the string resource that describes the warning type.
The warning code.
The Help keyword to associate with the warning.
The path to the file containing the warning.
The line in the file where the warning occurs.
The column in the file where the warning occurs.
The end line in the file where the warning occurs.
The end column in the file where the warning occurs.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
messageResourceName is `null`.
Logs a warning with a warning code using the specified resource string.
If the message begins with a warning code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message.
The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix.
A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
messageResourceName is `null`.
Logs a warning with a warning code using the specified resource string and other warning details.
If the message begins with a warning code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message.
The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix.
A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.
The parameters `subCategoryResourceName`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.
The name of the string resource that describes the warning type.
The path to the file containing the warning.
The line in the file where the warning occurs.
The column in the file where the warning occurs.
The end line in the file where the warning occurs.
The end column in the file where the warning occurs.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
messageResourceName is `null`.
Notifies this `TaskLoggingHelper` that it is no longer needed.
This method is thread safe, however, you must call both InitializeLifetimeService and MarkAsInactive, in that order, or you must call neither method, and you must call neither method than once.
Gets the name of the parent task.
The name of the parent task.
Gets or sets the culture-specific resources used by the logging methods.
If derived classes have localized strings, then they should register their resources with this property.
A <xref href="System.Resources.ResourceManager"></xref> that represents the culture-specific resources used by the logging methods.
This value can be `null`.
